newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS - Davids says still sees higher profit.
newsitem.headline: RTRS - Davids says still sees higher profit.

text.p: Grocery wholesaler Davids ltd said on Monday it still expects to report a higher profit in the 1996/97 financial year and that it saw sales of around A$8 billion in 1996/97, rising to A$10 billion in 1997/98.

"We expect sales of A$8.0 billion this year and also we expect to report a higher profit and sales are likely to rise to about A$10 billion in 1997/98," chairman John David said at the annual meeting.
The company achieved an 11.9 percent rise in 1995/96 (July-June) net profit to A$51.8 million from A$46.3 million a year earlier.
Sales rose to A$3.92 billion from A$3.23 billion.
